name: Champagne Cocktail
description: For many people New Year's Eve means breaking out the bubbly, but all too often the bottles are kept socked away until midnight. That's a shame—good Champagne and other sparkling wines are great to enjoy throughout the evening (in moderation, of course). And as a bonus, modest wines easily take on a new, more luscious character with just a little help from the liquor cabinet.
recipeIngredient: Dry Champagne or other sparkling wine

recipeInstructions.text: Place the sugar cube on a small saucer and douse with two or three dashes of bitters. Place the sugar in the bottom of a Champagne flute, and fill with sparkling wine (careful—the sugar will make the wine foam, so go slow). Twist a piece of lemon peel over the drink and use as garnish.
